ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I was able to get a comprehensive overview of Jewish History.
I learned a lot about the early times of the Jews, their belief systems, and their political systems within the confines of other religious empires.
I learned a lot about the general history of the Jewish people across a long span of history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Lack of organization in lectures, but other than that, very good.

I found the course packet from Tyco very difficult to work with. Most of the readings were unlabeled excerpts and not in any particular order. I often skipped readings when I could not find them, even after flipping through the entire 400 page packet. While this was frustrating, the lecture usually summarized the important readings enough so even if I could not find them I understood the purpose. Overall I really enjoyed the lectures. I think the topics we learned about were really interesting and the professor was engaging.

The lectures are a bit unstructured which puts a lot of pressure on the students to be diligent with note-taking and then organizing the notes chronologically after the lecture. That said, Prof Marcus is pretty striaghtforward with the two exams and the paper so there are no tricks.
The readings were useful and the lectures generally pretty interesting.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, if you are interested in Christianity, Judaism, or Islam, and want to learn more about the historical background of each of these religions, then I would recommend taking this class.
Yes, I would! The course is a very good overview of pre-industrial Jewish history. So long as you have an interest in Jewish history, you will do well and find it rewarding.
Yes, this course is an excellent way to learn a lot about the Jewish people and their history.

extras.title: ER&M 219 01/HIST 219 01/HIST 596 01/JDST 200 01/JDST 761 01/MDVL 596 01/MMES 149 01/RLST 148 01/RLST 773 01 - History of Jews to EarlyModern
